TopicTitle: 'Fuel Crossfeed' and 'Crew Light Enabled' toggles don't apply to all symmetrically placed parts

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.2.0 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Windows 10 | CPU: Intel i5-10300H | GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650 Ti | RAM: 16384 MB

 

Severity: Low (Though it could take a while to realize the bug is occurring)

Frequency: Affects all parts with the Fuel Crossfeed or Crew Light Enabled toggles.

Steps to Replicate:

  1. Attach the BZ-52 Radial Attachment Point with any non 1x symmetry (Not necessary for parts that can already be radially attached)
  2. Radially attach a part with an affected setting using symmetry (Such as a Decoupler for Fuel Crossfeed)
  3. Toggle the affected setting on one of the symmetrical parts

Expected: All of the parts placed in symmetry would have the setting toggled
Actual: Only the selected part would have the setting toggled

Other Notes:
I noticed this happening when I didn't get the expected DeltaV on a  craft I was building. Upon discovering the bug, I replicated it with just a fuel tank and some decouplers.
The video shows how it affects different settings. Note that it doesn't affect all toggles, such as toggling torques: I only saw the bug with the two mentioned settings.
